Sun.description: The star at the center of the solar system.
facts: Contains 99.8% of the solar system's mass
Source of light and heat for the planets

Mercury.description: The smallest planet in the solar system.
facts: Closest to the Sun
No moons
Extreme temperature variations

Venus.description: The second planet from the Sun, known for its thick atmosphere.
facts: Hotter than Mercury
Has a thick atmosphere
Rotates in the opposite direction of most planets

Earth.description: Our home planet, the only known planet to support life.
facts: Has life
The only planet known to support life
Has one natural satellite, the Moon

Mars.description: The Red Planet, known for its iron-rich soil.
facts: Home to the tallest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons
Has the largest dust storms
Possible past existence of liquid water

Jupiter.description: The largest planet in the solar system, a gas giant.
facts: Has the Great Red Spot, a giant storm
Has at least 79 known moons
Strongest magnetic field of any planet

Saturn.description: A gas giant known for its spectacular ring system.
facts: Has thousands of rings
Less dense than water
Has more than 80 known moons

Uranus.description: An ice giant that rotates on its side.
facts: Has a bluish-green color due to methane in its atmosphere
Coldest planet in the solar system
Has faint rings

Neptune.description: The farthest planet from the Sun, an ice giant.
facts: Has the strongest winds in the solar system
Appears deep blue due to methane
Has 14 known moons, including Triton
